autotracking_ExAr_h.txt1: Create an 'Exclude Window' to configure an area where movement is to be ignored. To prevent camera movement during the configuration of 'Exclude Areas', enable the Control Queue under Dome Configuration > Advanced > Control Queue. Once enabled, request control of the camera by clicking in the image whereby autotracking and Guard Tour will be temporarily disabled.
autotracking_ExAr_h.txt3: Click Add area and a blue rectangle will appear in the video stream. Click the top bar to move the rectangle and click and pull the bottom right hand corner to resize the rectangle.
autotracking_ExAr_h.txt4: Enter a descriptive name for the exclude window and click Save to save the settings in the list of Exclude Areas.
autotracking_ExAr_h.txt6: The blue rectangles will not be visible on the Live View page.
autotracking_ExAr_h.txt8: Click the name of the Exclude Area to be removed and click Remove.
autotracking_ExAr_h.txt10: Enable/Disable to enable or disable the configured Exclude Area.

autotracking_h.txt1: Autotracking detects movement in the camera's field of view and will follow the motion, e.g. a person or vehicle, until it disappears from the monitored area. The camera will automatically pan and tilt to follow the motion and, if there is a lot of movement simultaneously in the view, the area with the most amount of motion will be monitored.
autotracking_h.txt2: When there are no moving objects in the field of view, the camera will return to the 'home' position, if this feature is enabled under PTZ > Preset positions.
autotracking_h.txt4: The autotracking feature is designed for areas where there is a limited amount of movement.
autotracking_h.txt5: If autotracking and Guard Tour are both enabled, it is strongly recommended that the PTZ Control Queue is enabled. The PTZ Control Queue will make sure that the Guard Tour will have lower priority than autotracking, preventing the camera from abandoning autotracking in order to maintain a Guard Tour.
autotracking_h.txt6: Autotracking will not trigger on movement within an area blocked by a Privacy Mask or Exclude Area nor will it follow movement beyond the limits of a Privacy Mask or autotracking Max Limits.
autotracking_h.txt7: Start/Stop Autotracking - Click the Start button to manually start autotracking and click the Stop button to manually stop autotracking.
autotracking_h.settingTxt: Movement trigger sensitivity - Select High, Medium, or Low to define the sensitivity level for autotracking. Medium sensitivity is the recommended setting but high or low may suit certain areas better depending on the image contrast and size of the moving objects in the monitored area.

autotracking_MaLi_h.txt1: Set the values (in degrees) to define the pan and tilt limits for the area where autotracking is allowed. Any movement in the field of view beyond the set limits will be ignored, for example in outdoor surveillance; birds in the sky may not be of interest and could be excluded using this function. In the preview window, the max limits will be highlighted by blue horizontal and vertical bars. Click on these bars in order to move them to the desired position.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt2: Enable tilt limit -Click the checkbox to enable the tilt limits.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt3: Lower tilt angle - Enter a value (in degrees) to set the bottom limit or click on the blue Lower tilt angle link to activate the blue horizontal bar that represents the lower limit.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt4: Upper tilt angle - Enter a value (in degrees) to set the top limit or click on the blue Upper tilt angle link to activate the blue horizontal bar that represents the upper limit.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt5: Enable pan limit - Click the checkbox to enable the pan limits.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt6: The area between Start and Stop will be permitted for autotracking and the field of view beyond the set limits will be ignored.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt7: Pan limit start - Enter a value (in degrees) to set the limit starts in the current view or click on the blue Pan limit start link to activate the blue vertical bar that represents where the limit starts.
autotracking_MaLi_h.txt8: Pan limit end - Enter a value (in degrees) to set where the limit stops in the current view or click on the blue Pan limit end link to activate the blue vertical bar that represents where the limit stops.
